findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract stops transactions for all users excluding addresses that are excluded from fees, but cannot stop transactions once the tradingEnabled variable is enabled by the contract owner.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal numbers can result in rounding errors due to Solidity's implementation of division, leading to issues with precise calculations and potential loss of funds.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to a `marketingWallet` and `treasuryFundWallet` as part of the transfer flow. This address can either be a wallet address or a contract. If the address belongs to a contract then it may revert from incoming payment. As a result, the error will propagate to the token’s contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the price of the token can be highly volatile, potentially leading to significant price volatility for parties involved.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract uses variables initialized only in the constructor and not mutated by other functions, but they are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can negatively impact readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and may contain syntax, type, out-of-bounds, stack, or revert errors if not carefully tested and debugged.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful according to the ERC20 specification, otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
